testcase.name: test_task12_make_migrations

failure.message: Did you use `manage.py makemigrations` to create the `Tag` migrations file? Don't forget to `add` it to the git repo.

testcase.failure: Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\Pedro\Documents\GitHub\python-django-models-authentication\module4\tests.py", line 285, in test_task12_make_migrations self.assertTrue(self.check_migration('mainapp/migrations/', 'Tag'), msg=msg) File "C:\Users\Pedro\Documents\GitHub\python-django-models-authentication\support\SimplerTestCase.py", line 12, in assertTrue self.fail(msg or (str(expr) + "is not True")) AssertionError: Did you use `manage.py makemigrations` to create the `Tag` migrations file? Don't forget to `add` it to the git repo.

testcase.name: test_task9_url_reverser

failure.message: In `get_absolute_url()` the second argument in `reverse()` should be `args=[str(self.name)]`.

testcase.failure: Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\Pedro\Documents\GitHub\python-django-models-authentication\module4\tests.py", line 244, in test_task9_url_reverser self.assertTrue(self.get_absolute_url_args_correct, msg="In `get_absolute_url()` the second argument in `reverse()` should be `args=[str(self.name)]`.") File "C:\Users\Pedro\Documents\GitHub\python-django-models-authentication\support\SimplerTestCase.py", line 12, in assertTrue self.fail(msg or (str(expr) + "is not True")) AssertionError: In `get_absolute_url()` the second argument in `reverse()` should be `args=[str(self.name)]`.
